intro: Dichromena microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed dichromena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. It typically grows in woodland and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Dichromena microcephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
